thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Friday, 27 Apr 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Fourteen more fall sick from E. coli linked to romaine lettuce - CDC

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Fourteen more fall sick from E. coli linked to romaine lettuce - CDC

organizations.name: u.s. centers for disease control and prevention

text:
April 27 (Reuters) - Fourteen more sick people from eight U.S. states were added to an investigation of an E. coli outbreak linked to romaine lettuce, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said on Friday.
Three more states - Mississippi, Tennessee and Wisconsin - reported ill people, the CDC said here
Eighty-four people infected with a strain of E. coli have been reported from 19 states, the CDC had said on Wednesday, in an update to its investigation into the outbreak.
The regulator has advised people not to eat or buy romaine lettuce, commonly used in salads, unless they can confirm it is not from the Yuma, Arizona growing region.
Forty-two people had been hospitalized, including nine who had developed a type of kidney failure, the CDC said. (Reporting by Manas Mishra in Bengaluru; Editing by Sai Sachin Ravikumar)
